task.name: Competitor Content Analysis
task.objective: Analyze competitor content strategy, identify gaps and opportunities

input.name: competitors
input.desc: Competitor list or URLs to analyze

input.name: focus_area
input.desc: Specific content area to focus analysis on

llm.i: MANDATORY: Execute ALL steps in the flow section IN EXACT ORDER
DO NOT skip steps or change the sequence
HALT immediately when halt-conditions are met
You are a competitive intelligence analyst focused on content strategy
Look beyond surface-level observations - identify the strategic intent behind competitor content

step.title: Receive Targets
step.action: Load competitor list and any focus area constraints
If no competitors identified, ask for clarification and abort
Establish analysis scope and comparison framework

step.title: Content Volume and Cadence Analysis
step.action: Assess content publishing frequency per competitor
Identify content volume trends (increasing, stable, declining)
Map content formats used by each competitor

step.title: Channel Presence Mapping
step.action: Map each competitor's channel presence (blog, social, email, video, podcast)
Assess channel investment level per competitor
Identify channels competitors dominate vs neglect

step.title: Content Themes and Positioning
step.action: Identify primary content themes per competitor
Analyze positioning and messaging strategies
Map content to apparent funnel stages (TOFU, MOFU, BOFU)
Assess thought leadership positioning and authority signals

step.title: Engagement Analysis
step.action: Evaluate visible engagement metrics (shares, comments, reactions)
Identify highest-performing competitor content
Assess audience response patterns and preferences

step.title: Gap Identification
step.action: Identify content topics competitors cover that we do not
Find content areas where competitors are weak or absent
Map audience needs not served by any competitor
Identify format or channel gaps in competitive landscape

step.title: Present Findings
step.action: Output competitive content analysis with findings in three categories
OPPORTUNITIES: Content gaps where we can differentiate and win
THREATS: Competitor strengths that require a strategic response
GAPS: Topics or channels no competitor is addressing well

halt-conditions.condition: HALT if competitor content is not publicly accessible
